meanings.definition: The quality of being able to stimulate an immune response.
meanings.sent1: The antigenicity of the virus triggered a strong immune reaction in the body.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the antigenicity of different substances to understand their impact on immunity.
meanings.sent3: The antigenicity of the alien spaceship made it a target for the body's defense mechanisms.
meanings.sent4: The antigenicity of the new protein was like a red flag to the immune system, causing it to react swiftly.
meanings.sent5: The antigenicity of the vaccine was so high that it effectively primed the immune system for any future encounters.

meanings.definition: The property of being recognized by the immune system as foreign.
meanings.sent1: The antigenicity of the bacteria made it easily identifiable as a threat by the immune system.
meanings.sent2: Doctors use tests to determine the antigenicity of a substance to assess its potential harm.
meanings.sent3: The antigenicity of the disguised virus fooled the immune system momentarily.
meanings.sent4: The antigenicity of the intruder was so clear that the immune system swiftly launched a defense.
meanings.sent5: The antigenicity of the allergen was so pronounced that the immune system reacted immediately upon contact.
